status: Not permitted. Banned in Australia, Japan, Norway and US.
info: The disodium salt of disulphonic acid. A synthetic 'coal tar' dye.
name: Quinoline Yellow
foods: Smoked fish, ice cream, scotch eggs and smoked haddock. Used in lipsticks hair products, colognes; also in a wide range of medications;
notice: Cause dermatitis. Not recommended for consumption by children. HACSG recommends to avoid it.
